page.title: 02THE HISTORY OF KIRKBY
page.content: Kirkby-The settlement by the church was mentioned in the Domesday book in 1086 as Cherchebi. Then it had a population of 70. It is a mixture of the urban and the rural, the new and the old. The new town of Kirkby was started in 1952 as an overspill area of Liverpool. The town had problems from the outset-houses were completed before schools and shops and as many wage-earners still worked in Liverpool, and the public transport system was ineffective, getting to work became a mammoth operation. In recent years Kirkby has stabilised and became more established, it is less Sunday supplement material than it once was but unemployment is soaring & the industrial estate declining.{
